default: (a) a {@item shield|XPHB} or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|type=simple weapon=sand|category=basic}
(a) a {@item component pouch|XPHB} or (b) an {@item arcane focus|XPHB} or {@item druidic focus|XPHB}
(a) a {@item explorer's pack|XPHB} or (b) an {@item dungeoneer's pack|XPHB}

fluff.name: Shaman
entries: Nature is a powerful force containing a myriad of mysterious magics. Shamans have the ability - learned, intuited, or innate - to act as a conduit for that natural magic.
Shamans channel ancient rites in the form of runes, summon elemental spirits, and evoke powerful elemental magic to manipulate their enemies and allies alike.

entries.name: Creating a Shaman
entries: To create a Shaman, consult the subsections which give you hit points, proficiencies, and starting equipment. Then look at the Shaman table to see which features you get at each level. The descriptions of those features appear below.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a Shaman quickly with these suggestions: First, put your highest ability score in Wisdom, followed by Constitution or Dexterity; second, choose the Outlander background; third, choose the {@spell Produce Flame|XPHB} and {@spell Dancing Lights|XPHB} cantrips, along with the 1st-level {@spell Ice Knife|XGE} and {@spell Thunderwave|XPHB} spells.

entries.name: Multiclassing and the Shaman
entries: If your group uses the optional rule on multiclassing in the Player's Handbook, here's what you need to know if you choose Shaman as one of your classes.

entries.name: Ability Score Minimum
entries: As a multiclass character, you must have at least a Wisdom score of 13 to take a level in this class, or to take a level in another class if you are already a Shaman.

entries.name: Proficiencies Gained
entries: If Shaman isn't your initial class, here are the proficiencies you gain when you take your first level as a Shaman: light armor and simple weapons.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: To determine your available spell slots, you include all of your Shaman levels.

classFeature.name: Optional Rule: Alternate Ability Shaman
entries: While Shamans channel nature's magic in a similar mystical manner to druids, it is also possible to learn this power through study, or through force of will in dedication to nature.
If this is the case for your Shaman, you may prefer to use Intelligence or Charisma instead of Wisdom for your shaman features. If you do so, make the following changes:

items: Wherever you would use Wisdom for your shaman features or specialism features, such as your Spellcasting or Rune features, you instead use your chosen ability.
If you choose Intelligence, you replace Charisma as a saving throw proficiency given by this class with Intelligence.
A multiclassed character would require a 13 in the chosen ability (instead of Wisdom) to take a level in this class, or take a level in another if Shaman is your first class.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: Your experience in nature has infused you with the primordial magics of the world. This could be a life in a tribe, time spent wandering the wilds and finding a spirit, or unexpected communion with a nature deity. Whatever its origin, it fuels your spellcasting. You can channel these primal magics to strike those who would defy nature, restore your allies, and manipulate the world around you.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know two cantrips of your choice from the Shaman spell list. You learn an additional cantrip of your choice at 7th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Shaman table above shows how many spell slots you have to cast your {@filter shaman spells|spells|class=Shaman} of 1st-level or higher. To cast one, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all of your expended spell slots when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest}.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: You know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the shaman spell list.
You learn an additional Shaman spell of your choice every level, and every other level from level 11 onwards.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the Shaman spells you know and replace it with another spell from the Shaman spell list, which must also be a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for Shaman spells as you draw magic from your connection to nature. You use your Wisdom when a Shaman spell refers to your spellcasting ability, and you use your Wisdom modifier whenever you set the saving throw DC or make a spell attack roll for one of your Shaman spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a {@item druidic focus|XPHB} as a spellcasting focus for your shaman spells. You or your DM may decide it more appropriate to use an {@item arcane focus|XPHB}, depending on how your shaman learned their magic.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: Your connection to nature can be channeled with time, at less cost to yourself. You can cast a shaman spell you know as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag.

classFeature.name: Paths of the Shaman
entries: You have dedicated yourself to one of the following Shamanic paths, a specific approach to channeling the power of nature or its spirits.

entries.name: Path of the Conduit
entries: You are a conduit for nature's power directly. Shamans who take this path focus on the raw power of their spellcasting instead of any other means.

items: {@b Primal Clarity.} You can use a {@variantrule Reaction} to maintain {@status concentration} on a Shaman spell you cast if you would otherwise lose it. You can do this once, and regain the ability to do so after completing a {@variantrule Short Rest}.

entries.name: Path of the Runeblade
entries: The Runeblade is a direct means of controlling your primal magic into combat. Shamans who take this path are likely to be the first into the fray, using magic to shore up their martial offense.

items: {@b Runeblade.} As a {@variantrule Bonus Action}, you can conjure a Runeblade - an unusual Shaman-crafted weapon with a long hilt and blade, each emblazoned with Runes representing your primal magic. A Runeblade is a martial melee weapon with the Versatile property. While wielded in two hands, it has the Reach property. It deals {@dice 1d8} ({@dice 1d10}) slashing damage plus the ability modifier used for the attack roll. Alternatively, you can have it take the form of a simple or martial weapon of your choice. It disappears if you conjure another or if it is out of your possession for one minute or more. It acts as a spell focus for your Shaman spells.
{@b Runeblade Conversion.} Over the course of an hour's ritual, you can convert a magical weapon to be your Runeblade, and can do so to only one magical weapon at a time.
{@b Battle Ready.} You gain proficiency with martial weapons, medium armor, and shields.

entries.name: Path of the Conjurer
entries: You manifest primal power differently, through tiny spirits in the form of totems. Shamans who take this path use their totems to aid their allies and hinder their foes in a variety of ways.

items: {@b Totems.} You gain the ability to summon a nature spirit totem. These tiny elemental creatures each apply a unique effect in a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from themselves. If a totem deals damage, you are considered to have done that damage. Summoning a totem requires an Action, and you can have two such totems active at any time. Each totem lasts one minute. You can summon a Totem at no cost, but must expend a first level spell slot or complete a Short Rest to do so again. You know how to summon two totems from the list below, and can change your selection whenever you gain a level in this class.
{@b Taunting.} Creatures of your choice have disadvantage when attacking any creature in the area that isn't the totem.
{@b Warding.} {@condition Halted|Starlight|Halt} creatures of your choice who enter the emanation or end their turn in it.
{@b Warning.} You and allies in the area gain a +2 bonus to saving throws while in the emanation.

{@b Lifting.} Creatures of your choice who enter the area can be lifted, leaping up to 30 feet in a direction they choose. Creatures who start their turn in the area gain 10 feet of movement speed until the start of their next turn.
{@b Blessing.} Creatures of your choice can gain a +2 bonus to an attack roll or ability check once each round.
{@b Manatide.} Creatures in the area gain +2 spell power.

entries.name: Path of the Seer
entries: You can commune with spirits more directly, guiding them to assist you and your allies in many ways. Shamans who take this path might serve the role of oracles, advisors, or spiritual leaders.

items: {@b Guiding Spirits.} You can direct primordial spirits to assist your nearby allies. You can take the {@action Help} Action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action} and at a range of 30 feet.
{@b Spiritual Insights.} You gain proficiency in the {@skill Religion} or {@skill History} skill (your choice).

classFeature.name: Primordial Runes
entries: Your access to the primal forces of the world has granted you access to Primordial Runes, fragments of primal spirits which can enhance your own power, grant you new abilities or empower your existing ones.

At 2nd level, you gain 2 Primordial Runes of your choice. A list of the available options can be found on the {@filter Optional Features|optionalfeatures|feature type=PRU} page. When you gain certain Shaman levels, you gain additional runes of your choice, as shown in the Runes column of the Shaman table.
Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the runes you know and replace it with another that you could learn at that level.

If a rune has prerequisites, you must meet them to gain that rune. You can gain a rune at the same time you meet its prerequisites. A level prerequisite refers to your level in this class. If you lose the prerequisite for a rune, by changing your elemental affinity for example, you may replace it with another rune for which you meet the prerequisite.

classFeature.name: Elemental Affinity
entries: You are attuned with all aspects of nature, but one speaks to you much more strongly.
When you choose an Elemental Affinity, you gain a cantrip from the options listed and become resistant to that damage type.
You will also gain access to a series of Primordial Runes that can deepen your affinity.

entries.name: Affinity with Flame (Fire)
entries: You gain the {@spell Firebolt|XPHB} or {@spell Green-Flame Blade|TCE} cantrip.

entries.name: Affinity with Frost (Cold)
entries: You gain the {@spell Ray of Frost|XPHB} or {@spell Frostbite|XGE} cantrip.

entries.name: Affinity with Lightning (Lightning)
entries: You gain the {@spell Crackling Bolt|J:General} or {@spell Shocking Grasp|XPHB} cantrip.

entries.name: Affinity with Thunder (Thunder)
entries: You gain the {@spell Thunderclap|XPHB} or {@spell Booming Blade|TCE} cantrip.

entries.name: Affinity with Acid (Acid)
entries: You gain the {@spell Acid Splash|XPHB} or {@spell Primal Savagery|XGE} cantrip.
You can change your elemental affinity whenever you gain a level in this class.

classFeature.name: Elemental Origin
entries: At 3rd level, you determine the origin of your shaman abilities. This could be the source that they are drawn from, where your Shaman grew up or learned their magic, or the specific location they first unlocked their magical gifts.
This origin grants you features at 3rd level, and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

classFeature.name: Elemental Origin Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your elemental origin.

classFeature.name: Down the Path
entries: You gain an additional benefit from your Path of the Shaman.

entries.name: Path of the Conduit
entries: You learn an additional Shaman cantrip of your choice and gain a bonus to Arcana checks equal to your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Path of the Runeblade
entries: Your Runeblade deals an additional 1d4 damage of a type matching your Elemental Affinity.

entries.name: Path of the Conjurer
entries: You know up to four totems from the list, and the list gains these additional options:

items: {@b Unerring Aim.} You may expend a {@variantrule Reaction} to grant a creature in your totem's emanation advantage on an attack roll it makes. You can do this before or after the roll.

{@b Vortex.} Creatures of your choice within range of this totem take damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity whenever they start their turn or enter the Totem's Emanation. The damage is a number of {@dice d4}s equal to your proficiency bonus.
{@b Life.} Creatures within this totem's Emanation have resistance to necrotic damage, and regain one hit point at the start of their turn if they do not have any.

entries.name: Path of the Seer
entries: You have advantage on Initiative rolls, and can swap your Initiative and a willing ally's at the start of combat.

classFeature.name: Elemental Origin Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your elemental origin.

classFeature.name: Elemental Origin Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your elemental origin.

classFeature.name: Elemental Embodiment
entries: At 18th level, you are a paragon of your chosen element. You become immune to the damage type of your chosen elemental affinity.

classFeature.name: Spiritual Avatar
entries: At 20th level, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action} to channel the spirits of nature directly for one minute, using yourself as a conduit. This might change your appearance as you choose to suit your elemental affinity or origin, such as your head being lit with flames, or your skin being covered with frost.
While this state is active, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a flying speed of 50 feet.
Whenever you cast a Shaman spell that has a casting time of one {@variantrule Action}, you can cast it using a {@variantrule Bonus Action} instead.

entries: At this level, you also have access to a Primordial Rune specific to your subclass that can enhance your Spiritual Avatar in another way.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you complete a {@variantrule Long Rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Waters
entries: Water is often described as the source of life. Shamans of the waters - be that rivers, lakes, or the sea - know this, and control water in order to control life itself. They can manipulate the flow of positive energies in order to manipulate the flow of battle. Using water's restorative magic to assist their allies, and the force of water to throw their enemies off-balance.

subclassFeature.name: Waters Shaman Spells
entries: {@i 3rd-level Waters Shaman feature}
You always know these spells from the table below once you reach certain levels in this class. You cannot swap these spells out on level up, unlike your normal Shaman spells.

entries.caption: Waters Shaman Spells
rows: {@spell Freedom of Movement|XPHB}, {@spell Aura of Purity|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Meandering Streams
entries: {@i 3rd-level Waters Shaman feature}

Water supplies life in all places, and water flows down mountains and across plains before reaching the sea. This intuitive knowledge of the wider world and its layout grants you proficiency with the {@skill Survival} skill and {@item cartographer's tools|XPHB}. It would also be reasonable to have waterproof paper or a waterproof pouch to keep your supplies in.
Additionally, you can hold your breath for twice as long as you otherwise could.

subclassFeature.name: Ebb
entries: {@i 3rd-level Waters Shaman feature}

You maintain balance, where life inevitably brings harm. When you restore hit points to a creature on your turn, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action} on that turn to throw a jet of powerful water at a creature within 30 feet. Make a spell attack roll. On a hit, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier and becomes {@condition Off-balance|Starlight}.

subclassFeature.name: Flow
entries: {@i 3rd-level Waters Shaman feature}

You maintain balance, where life springs from danger. When you deal damage to a creature on your turn, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action} on that turn to throw a jet of restorative water at a creature within 30 feet. The creature targeted regains hit points equal to {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Ebb and Flow Improvements
entries: {@i 6th-level Waters Shaman feature}

When you use your {@subclassFeature Ebb|Shaman|Starlight|Waters|Starlight|3|Starlight|Ebb} or {@subclassFeature Flow|Shaman|Starlight|Waters|Starlight|3|Starlight|Flow} water jet, its power increases to {@dice 2d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier, and its range is 60 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Seastrider
entries: {@i 6th-level Waters Shaman feature}
Your experience with waterlogged terrain means that you are no longer affected by difficult terrain on watery surfaces such as mud, marsh, shallow water, or similar terrain.

subclassFeature.name: Flow As Water
entries: {@i 10th-level Waters Shaman feature}
You can breathe underwater and gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

Furthermore, when you take damage, you can take on the form of water as a {@variantrule Reaction}. Until the end of your next turn, whenever you would take damage, you can treat any dice rolled for that damage as having rolled their minimum value instead. Your movement speed increases by 30 feet for the same duration
You can use this {@variantrule Reaction} once per {@variantrule Short Rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Master of the Tides
entries: {@i 14th-level Waters Shaman feature}
Your Ebb and Flow have improved to match the very motion of the world itself, in the model of the ocean's tides.
The power of the water jet increases to {@dice 2d10} + your spellcasting ability modifier and its range increases to 120 feet.

When you use {@subclassFeature Ebb|Shaman|Starlight|Waters|Starlight|3|Starlight|Ebb}, you can also use {@subclassFeature Flow|Shaman|Starlight|Waters|Starlight|3|Starlight|Flow} with the same {@variantrule Bonus Action}, and vice versa.

subclassFeature.name: Mountains
entries: The mountains are steadfast and towering, watching over the world and earth while being unmovable by any convential means. Shamans of the Mountains inhabit these places, settling on or within the mountains, moving stone, guarding themselves and others, and attuning to nature so as to carry out its will. They are stoic, often living introverted lives in small communities, but do valuable work in maintaining the balance of nature in the harsh climates of the mountains.

subclassFeature.name: Mountains Shaman Spells
entries: {@i 3rd-level Mountains Shaman feature}
You always know these spells from the table below once you reach certain levels in this class. You cannot swap these spells out on level up, unlike your normal Shaman spells.

subclassFeature.name: Mountain Home
entries: {@i 3rd-level Mountains Shaman feature}

The mountains have stood the test of time, and with that time comes knowledge. You gain proficiency in {@item mason's tools|XPHB} and have advantage on Intelligence checks made to identify information about or investigate the properties of rooms or objects comprised in some way of stone (for example, the history of a ruin, natural properties of mountains, investigating a stone room).

Furthermore, you count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift, and you are naturally adapted to cold climates when considering {@hazard extreme cold|DMG}.

subclassFeature.name: Mountainhide
entries: {@i 3rd-level Mountains Shaman feature}
Your skin is toughened by your elemental source. While you are not wearing armour, your AC is 13 plus your Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Earthen Scales
entries: {@i 3rd-level Mountains Shaman feature}

You can call on the spirits for active protection when creatures of the world are in danger. When you or a creature you can see within 30 feet takes damage, you can use a {@variantrule Reaction} to reduce that damage by {@dice 1d6} plus your Constitution modifier.
You can do this a number of times per {@variantrule Long Rest} equal to your proficiency bonus, or spend a spell slot of first level or higher to gain an additional use (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Earthly Attachments
entries: {@i 6th-level Mountains Shaman feature}
Your earthly connections deepend. The damage reduction of your Earthen Scales is increased to {@dice 2d6} plus your Constitution modifier.
Your Earthen Scales also recharges on a {@variantrule Short Rest}, instead of a {@variantrule Long Rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Hillswalker
entries: {@i 6th-level Mountains Shaman feature}
Your experience with mountainous terrain means that you are no longer affected by difficult terrain on surfaces made of stone or rocks, snow, ice, or similar ground.

subclassFeature.name: Earthen Scales Improvement
entries: {@i 10th-level Mountains Shaman feature}

The mountains watch over vast swathes of land, as you do, and now your own magic becomes a source of this protection. The damage reduction from your {@subclassFeature Earthen Scales|Shaman|Starlight|Mountains|Starlight|3|Starlight} increases to {@dice 3d6} plus your Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit of the Valley
entries: {@i 10th-level Mountains Shaman feature}

You can call on the chilling winds of the valley. You can use an {@variantrule Action} to {@condition slowed|Starlight|slow} all creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you until the end of your next turn. When you do so, you become Tough for the next minute; if you take 10 or less damage, you instead take no damage. Once you do, you cannot do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest}.

subclassFeature.name: True Mettle
entries: {@i 14th-level Mountains Shaman feature}

You are a titan of endurance, a bastion for your allies. The damage reduction from your {@subclassFeature Earthen Scales|Shaman|Starlight|Mountains|Starlight|3|Starlight} increases to {@dice 4d6} plus your Constitution modifier.

Alternatively, you can now use your Earthen Scales to protect a creature from death. When the target would be reduced to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage, you can expend a {@variantrule Reaction} and use of your Earthen Scales to reduce it to 1 hit point instead.

subclassFeature.name: Watcher of the World
entries: {@i 14th-level Mountains Shaman feature}
You resist even entropy itself. You age ten times slower than similar creatures due to your elemental origin. Each decade that passes causes you to age only one year.

subclassFeature.name: Dunes
entries: The dunes are unforgiving environments - be they hot or cold - and discretion is often the better part of survival. Shamans of the Dunes often live nomadic lifestyles, roving the deserts and ensuring that even such a harsh environment can continue its intended course. They are often reclusive, living within their travelling group, but may forge strong bonds - any survivor knows that surviving is easier done with allies at your side.

subclassFeature.name: Dunes Shaman Spells
entries: {@i 3rd-level Dunes Shaman feature}
You always know these spells from the table below once you reach certain levels in this class. You cannot swap these spells out on level up, unlike your normal Shaman spells.

subclassFeature.name: Life in the Dunes
entries: {@i 3rd-level Dunes Shaman feature}

Survival in a desert is no easy feat. You must be able to make do with scant resources, and able to avoid the predators and dangers that roam - an upfront approach is rarely your best choice. You gain proficiency in {@item cook's utensils|XPHB} and {@skill Stealth}.
Furthermore, you are naturally acclimated to hot or cold temperatures (depending on your desert) when considering {@hazard extreme heat|DMG} or {@hazard extreme cold|DMG}.

subclassFeature.name: Mirage
entries: {@i 3rd-level Dunes Shaman feature}

You can channel the power of the changing temperatures in the desert to conjure mirages. When you are targeted by an attack or ability that targets an area (such as a dragon's breath or a {@spell fireball|XPHB|fireball spell}), you can use your {@variantrule Reaction} to teleport 5 feet to an unoccupied space in a direction of your choice. If this would put you out of reach of the attack or effect, you avoid it.

subclassFeature.name: Control the Storm
entries: {@i 6th-level Dunes Shaman feature}

Deserts are known for their harsh weather conditions, and you can create some of your own. Once per {@variantrule Short Rest}, you can spend an {@variantrule Action} to create a storm of swirling particulates (such as snow or sand) in a 10-foot Emanation originating from you. This area provides half cover for you and your allies and is difficult terrain for creatures other than you to move through. The storm lasts for one minute or until you are {@condition Incapacitated}.

subclassFeature.name: Duneswalker
entries: {@i 6th-level Dunes Shaman feature}
You are practised in walking the deserts, and are not affected by difficult terrain consisting of sand, snow, or other similar materials such as fine gravel.

subclassFeature.name: Superior Mirage
entries: {@i 10th-level Dunes Shaman feature}

Your mirage is superior, increasing the distance that it covers. You can teleport up to 10 feet when using your {@subclassFeature Mirage|Shaman|Starlight|Dunes|Starlight|3|Starlight|mirage}, and you can spend a spell slot of any level to increase the distance you teleport by a number of feet equal to 10 times the slot level expended.

subclassFeature.name: Liquefaction
entries: {@i 14th-level Dunes Shaman feature}

You have learned much greater control over the desert storms. You can {@status concentration||concentrate} on your {@subclassFeature Control the Storm|Shaman|Starlight|Dunes|Starlight|6|Starlight|storm} when you summon it to increase its power, granting the following benefits.

items: You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action} to move the storm independently of yourself, up to 20 feet, where the storm then remains until you move it again.
The area is lightly obscured. You and creatures you choose can attempt to hide in this light obscurement.

Hostile creatures entering the storm or starting their turn in it must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 5d8} piercing damage and become {@condition blinded} until the start of their next turn.

entries: You can concentrate on the storm this way once per {@variantrule Long Rest}. If you lose your {@status concentration}, the storm ends and you must complete a {@variantrule Short Rest} to use it again, as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Forests
entries: Forests are a resilient and tricky environment, with flora and fauna that can be both friend and foe. They know who belongs and who does not. Shamans of the Forests understand this; they are as relentless as the forest itself and call on its powers to hunt down those who would threaten it.

subclassFeature.name: Forests Shaman Spells
entries: {@i 3rd-level Forests Shaman feature}
You always know these spells from the table below once you reach certain levels in this class. You cannot swap these spells out on level up, unlike your normal Shaman spells.

subclassFeature.name: Home in the Trees
entries: {@i 3rd-level Forests Shaman feature}

The rampant plant growth in a forested environment provides opportunity, but also cover. You are trained to see past that cover, and make use of plants and herbs available to you. You have proficiency with the {@item Herbalism Kit|XPHB} and with the {@skill Perception} skill.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Mark
entries: {@i 3rd-level Forests Shaman feature}
When you damage a creature, you can mark it until the end of your next turn. You can have only one creature marked this way at a time.

While marked, a creature cannot benefit from the {@variantrule Disengage} action, and if it ends its turn more than 30 feet away from you, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction} to move up to half your Speed towards it.
Additionally, it subtracts a {@dice 1d4} from melee attack rolls it makes against you.

subclassFeature.name: Canopy's Shelter
entries: {@i 3rd-level Forests Shaman feature}
While you are not {@condition Incapacitated}, ranged attacks made against you have disadvantage if the attacker is 30 feet or closer to you.

subclassFeature.name: Relentless Pursuit
entries: {@i 6th-level Forests Shaman feature}
When a creature marked by your Wild Mark ends its turn out of your reach, it takes damage equal to your Wisdom modifier. This damage cannot activate Wild Mark.
Any creature marked by your Wild Mark treats forest terrain (such as thick leafbeds, root-laden floors, or heavy undergrowth) as difficult terrain.

subclassFeature.name: Treeswalker
entries: {@i 6th-level Forests Shaman feature}
You are not affected by difficult terrain consisting of plants or similar foliage. If a plant is hazardous, such as being covered in spines, it does not harm you.
For you, the {@spell Plant Growth|XPHB} spell only requires you to spend 2 feet per 1 foot of movement.

subclassFeature.name: Looming Presence
entries: {@i 10th-level Forests Shaman feature}

You embody the spirit of the giant trees of the forest. While a creature marked by your Wild Mark is within your reach, you have advantage on opportunity attacks against it. If you hit it with an opportunity attack, it becomes {@condition Frightened} of you until the end of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Forest's Thorns
entries: {@i 14th-level Forests Shaman feature}

The first time each turn a creature within your reach hits you with an attack or forces you to make a saving throw, it takes damage equal to your Wisdom modifier of a type matching your Elemental Affinity or Psychic (you choose) and has Disadvantage on its next attack roll this turn.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Conduit
entries: You may add your spellcasting ability modifier to the damage you deal with any cantrip that deals fire, cold, thunder, lightning, or acid damage.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit's Intuition
entries: You learn the {@spell Guidance|XPHB} cantrip. It has a duration of ten minutes when you cast it.

optionalfeature.name: Moon's Spirit
entries: You do not need to sleep and cannot be forced to by any means. You can gain the benefits of a {@variantrule Long Rest} by doing 8 hours of light activity instead of sleeping.

optionalfeature.name: Natural Warrior
entries: You learn the {@spell Shillelagh} cantrip, and when you cast it it lasts for ten minutes and can be applied to any weapon with which you are proficient.

optionalfeature.name: Roots of the Tree
entries: You may a add bonus equal to your proficiency bonus to saving throws made to maintain your {@status concentration} on a spell.

optionalfeature.name: Nature's Understanding
entries: You can cast {@spell speak with animals} at will and without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Darkseer
entries: You gain darkvision out to 120 feet, or increase your existing darkvision by 120 feet. Your darkvision makes darkness appear as bright light to you, instead of dim.

optionalfeature.name: Sense Arcana
entries: You can cast {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB}, {@spell Detect Evil and Good}, and {@spell Detect Poison and Disease} once per {@variantrule Long Rest} each, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Lightfeet
entries: You learn the {@spell Longstrider|XPHB} and can cast it once per {@variantrule Long Rest} without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Jungle's Bounty
entries: You can cast the {@spell Goodberry|XPHB} spell once per {@variantrule Long Rest}. When you cast the spell in this way, you create an additional number of berries equal to your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Natural Instincts
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Survival} and {@skill Medicine} skills.

optionalfeature.name: Far Sight
entries: As part of an hour-long ritual, you look into the future, sensing a power you might require. You may ask a question about an event to occur within the next 7 days, and the DM may suggest a spell or type of spell that would prove beneficial. You can then swap one spell that you know for another on the Shaman spell list. You may do this only once each {@dice 2d4} days.
{@note The spell you can learn follows normal rules. For example, a 6th level Shaman could learn a 3rd level spell or lower, even if they had 4th level spell slots.}

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Manipulation
entries: You can change the damage type of a spell you cast to the damage type of your Elemental Affinity.

optionalfeature.name: Home at Sea
entries: You gain a swimming speed of 40 feet, or your walking speed, whichever is higher. If you already have a swimming speed, this increases it by 10 feet instead.
You also learn the {@spell Water Breathing|XPHB} spell, which doesn't count against your known Shaman spells.

optionalfeature.name: Home in the Trees
entries: You gain a climbing speed of 40 feet, or your walking speed, whichever is higher. If you already have a climbing speed, it increases to that amount
You learn the {@spell Spider Climbing} spell and cast it once per {@variantrule Long Rest} without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Forest Heart
entries: You learn the {@spell Summon Fey|TCE} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Gifts of the Elders
entries: You learn the {@spell Borrowed Knowledge|SCC} and {@spell Enhance Ability|XPHB} spells.

optionalfeature.name: Primordial Thorns
entries: Upon taking damage from a creature you can see, or one that is within 5 feet of you, you can spend a {@variantrule Reaction} to deal {@dice 1d6} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
This damage increases to {@dice 2d6} at 11th level.

optionalfeature.name: Rune of Elemental Superiority
entries: When you deal damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity, you ignore resistance to damage of that type.

optionalfeature.name: Druidic Teachings
entries: You learn the {@spell Polymorph} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Aversion
entries: You learn the {@spell Elemental Bane|XGE} spell. Once per {@variantrule Long Rest}, when you cast this spell, you can forgo the need to {@status concentration||concentrate} on it by reducing its duration to the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Keeper of the Grove
entries: Once per {@variantrule Short Rest}, you can attempt to allow nature to siphon a creature's magic for a turn.
The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@dice 3d12} radiant damage and becomes {@condition silenced|Starlight} until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Small Friends
entries: You learn the {@spell Insect Plague|XPHB} spell. You can communicate with insects freely.

optionalfeature.name: Nature Companion
entries: You can cast the {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} spell once per {@variantrule Long Rest} without expending material components. Your familiar takes the form of a {@creature Sapling Treant|Starlight} or a {@creature Raven|MM}.

optionalfeature.name: Forest Walker
entries: You learn the {@spell Transport Via Plants|XPHB} spell and can cast it once per {@variantrule Long Rest} without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Master of Roots
entries: Once per {@variantrule Long Rest}, you can cast the Grasping vine spell. When you do so, you can either cast the spell as a {@variantrule Bonus Action}, or forgo the need to {@status concentration||concentrate} on the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Command of Air
entries: You can cast the {@spell Fly|XPHB} spell at will.

optionalfeature.name: Earthly Intuition
entries: You gain Tremorsense to a range of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Nature's Will
entries: If you cast a spell and miss all of its attack roll(s), or all targets pass their saving throws to resist its effect, you can cast a cantrip as a {@variantrule Bonus Action} instead of an {@variantrule Action}. You may do this once per {@variantrule Short Rest}.

optionalfeature.name: Searing Totem
entries: You can summon a {@creature Searing Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}, which causes creatures to {@condition burning|Starlight|burn} on entering the area, or take {@damage 1d4} fire damage if they are already burning.

optionalfeature.name: Roaring Flames
entries: The size of your spells that deal fire damage, if they specify an area, increase by 5 feet when you cast them (for example, {@spell Burning Hands|XPHB} increases from a 15-foot cone to a 20-foot cone). If a spell specifies multiple dimensions, such as {@spell Wall of Fire|XPHB}, you choose one to increase.

optionalfeature.name: Compound Burns
entries: When you deal fire damage to a {@condition Burning|Starlight} creature, it takes additional damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Glacial Totem
entries: You can summon a {@creature Glacial Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}, which, to creatures you choose, makes the area surrounding it difficult terrain and prevents regaining of hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Ice Block
entries: On the turn that you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals cold damage to one or more creatures, you can gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus times the number of creatures you deal cold damage to with that spell.

optionalfeature.name: Absolute Zero
entries: Your {@b Biting Cold} feature is enhanced. The penalty now applies to the next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw that the target makes. It also imposes disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Voltaic Totem
entries: You can summon a {@creature Voltaic Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}, which prevents creatures of your choice within its area from taking {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB|Reactions}.

optionalfeature.name: Spasming Shocks
entries: Once per round, if you deal lightning damage to a creature by expending a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can cause it to be {@condition staggered|Starlight} until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Aftershock
entries: Your {@b Arc Lightning} feature improves. It can now affect up to four targets, and the range limitation of 15 feet is between targets affected by this feature, not the original target.

optionalfeature.name: Booming Totem
entries: You can summon a {@creature Booming Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}, which creates a shockwave that pushes creatures of your choosing away from the totem.

optionalfeature.name: Disorienting Thunderclap
entries: Once per turn, when you deal Thunder damage to a creature with a spell of 1st level or higher, it must make a Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Reverberating Thunder
entries: Your {@b Thundercrack} feature improves. You are able to push creatures of any size, and the distance increases to 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Caustic Totem
entries: You can summon a {@creature Caustic Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}, which reduces the AC of creatures of your choice in its area by 2.

optionalfeature.name: Rapid Erosion
entries: When you deal acid damage to a creature with a spell of 1st level or higher, it becomes {@condition Melting|Starlight}.
The {@variantrule Action} used to end the Melting condition also ends your Persistent Corrosion, and vice versa.

optionalfeature.name: Viscous Acid
entries: Your {@b Persistent Corrosion} feature improves. A creature suffering from the effect is {@condition Hampered|Starlight} and deals {@damage 1d6} less damage with weapon attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Resilience
entries: When you use your {@subclassFeature Earthen Scales|Shaman|Starlight|Mountains|Starlight|3|Starlight|Earthen Scales}, you can grant a creature resistance to the triggering damage alongside your normal reduction. This lasts until the start of their next turn.
You can do this once, and must complete a {@variantrule Short Rest} or {@variantrule Long Rest} before you can do so again.

optionalfeature.name: Mountain's Echo
entries: When you use your {@subclassFeature Earthen Scales|Shaman|Starlight|Mountains|Starlight|3|Starlight|Earthen Scales}, the creature you target can use a {@variantrule Reaction} to make a weapon attack.

optionalfeature.name: Avatar of the Mountains
entries: When using your {@classFeature Spiritual Avatar|Shaman|Starlight|20|Starlight|spiritual avatar} feature, you are resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: High-pressure Jet
entries: Your {@subclassFeature Ebb|Shaman|Starlight|Waters|Starlight|3|Starlight|Ebb} and {@subclassFeature Flow|Shaman|Starlight|Waters|Starlight|3|Starlight|Flow} water jets also push creatures back 5 feet when you hit them with it. At level 14, this increases to 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Geyser
entries: When you use your {@subclassFeature Ebb|Shaman|Starlight|Waters|Starlight|3|Starlight|Ebb} and {@subclassFeature Flow|Shaman|Starlight|Waters|Starlight|3|Starlight|Flow} water jets, you can choose to make its damage match your elemental affinity instead of bludgeoning.

optionalfeature.name: Avatar of the Waters
entries: When using your {@classFeature Spiritual Avatar|Shaman|Starlight|20|Starlight|spiritual avatar} feature, you regain 15 hit points at the start of each of your turns.

optionalfeature.name: Empowered Mirage
entries: When using your {@subclassFeature Mirage|Shaman|Starlight|Dunes|Starlight|3|Starlight}, you can deal damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity equal to your proficiency bonus to all other creatures of your choice within 5 feet of the space you left.

optionalfeature.name: Avatar of the Dunes
entries: When using your {@classFeature Spiritual Avatar|Shaman|Starlight|20|Starlight|spiritual avatar} feature, you gain an additional {@variantrule Reaction} each round.

optionalfeature.name: Avatar of the Forests
entries: When using your {@classFeature Spiritual Avatar|Shaman|Starlight|20|Starlight|spiritual avatar} feature, you are naturally camouflaged. When taking damage, you can use a {@variantrule Reaction} to become {@condition Invisible} until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Rune of Totem Summoning
entries: You gain the ability to conjure a Nature Spirit Totem. This tiny elemental creature applies an effect to an area within 15 feet of itself. If a totem deals damage, you are considered to have done that damage.

Summoning a totem requires an {@variantrule Action}, and the totem appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of you, and lasts for one minute. Once summoned, you cannot do so again until you complete a {@variantrule Long Rest} or unless you expend a spell slot of first level or higher.

The totem requires your {@status concentration} (as if you were concentrating on a spell), however, you can summon additional totems using the same concentration. Whenever you fail a Constitution saving throw to maintain your concentration, you choose one totem to disappear. If you use another effect which requires concentration such as a spell, they all disappear.
You know how to summon two totems from the list below. You can change your selection whenever you gain a level in this class.

items: {@creature Taunting Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}
{@creature Warding Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}
{@creature Warning Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}
{@creature Lifting Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}
{@creature Blessing Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}
{@creature Wrath of Air Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}

optionalfeature.name: Totemkeeper
entries: When expending a spell slot to summon a totem, you may summon two at once if the spell slot expended is of third level or higher.

optionalfeature.name: Totemic Blast
entries: Your totems gain the ability to launch a blast of elemental magic. The blast uses your spell attack modifier, is fired from an active totem using your {@variantrule Bonus Action}, and deals {@damage 1d8+PB} damage of a type matching your elemental affinity.
{@note This ability is listed in the Nature Spirit Totems' statistics.}

optionalfeature.name: Totemic Might
entries: When you summon a totem, it gains temporary hit points equal to twice your proficiency bonus.
{@note This ability is listed in the Nature Spirit Totems' statistics.}

optionalfeature.name: Totem Commander
entries: You have greater control over where your totems are summoned. You can summon them in the air, or attached to you or a willing creature.

A totem attached to a creature moves with it, but can still be targeted individually. If attached to a creature, you can expend a {@variantrule Reaction} to force the totem to be the new target of an attack that would otherwise hit the creature it is attached to.
{@note This ability is listed in the Nature Spirit Totems' statistics.}

optionalfeature.name: Totem Specialist
entries: You learn how to summon two more totems from the list in the {@optfeature Rune of Totem Summoning|Starlight}.
Furthermore, your totems become proficient in all saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Enforcement Totem
entries: You learn how to summon a {@creature Enforcement Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}, which grants creatures of your choice temporary hit points at the start of each of your turns and prevents them from being moved against their will.

optionalfeature.name: Manarage Totem
entries: You learn how to summon a {@creature Manarage Nature Spirit Totem|Starlight}. You can summon it once per short rest and it provides the following benefits:
Creatures within the area have +2 spellpower.

spell.name: Earth Shock
entries: You channel the earth's might to suppress another creature. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage and is {@condition Silenced|Starlight} until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d4|1-9|1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Frost Shock

components.m: An drop of water or an ice cube

entries: You conjure a mote of pure cold and launch it at your target. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d4} cold damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is {@condition Halted|Starlight} until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, it is {@condition Slowed|Starlight} instead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d4|1-9|1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Vitality Hex

components.m: A used match, torch, or lantern

entries: You weave a cloak of shadow over a target's lifeforce. The target takes {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage becomes hexed for the duration of the spell. While hexed, once on each turn when the target takes damage (including from the casting of this spell), you regain {@damage 1d6} hit points. The target can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the healing gained increases to {@damage 2d6} and any damage the target takes is increased by {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage.

spell.name: Primordial Spark
entries: You conjure a wisp of primordial magic and launch it at a creature or object within range. Choose on effect from the options below. You make an attack roll, dealing {@dice 1d8} damage of the chosen type and gaining the additional benefit specified.

entries.name: Searing Flame (Fire)
entries: If you roll an 8 on a {@dice d8} for this spell, you can roll another and add it to the damage. The maximum number of dice added this way equals your spellcasting ability modifier.

entries.name: Ancient Frost (Cold)
entries: Treat any roll below 3 on the {@dice d8}s for this spell as a 3.

entries.name: Disruptive Spark (Lightning)
entries: The target cannot take a {@variantrule Reaction} until the end of your current turn.

entries.name: Reverberating Thunder (Thunder)
entries: The target is {@condition Deafened}.

entries.name: Splashing Acid (Acid)
entries: The target's space(s) becomes filled with acid that deals 1d8 damage to the next creature who enters it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d8}), 11 ({@dice 3d8}), and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Primordial Eruption

m.text: A chunk of obsidian worth at least 50gp

entries: An elemental disturbance causes the ground to split. Choose one effect from the options below. Creatures within a 15-foot cube that originates at a point of your choosing on the ground must make a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} damage of the chosen type and suffer the chosen effect. Creatures take half as much damage on a successful save.

entries.name: Molten Earth (Fire)
entries: Lava sprays upwards. Creatures who failed the saving throw fall {@condition Prone}. Prone creatures within the area take an additional {@damage 1d8} fire damage.

entries.name: Frozen Fissure (Cold)
entries: Creatures that fail the saving throw are {@condition Restrained} until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Fulminant Fault (Lightning)
entries: The speed at which the eruption occurs leaves creatures who fail the saving throw {@condition Staggered|Starlight} until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Seismic Burst (Thunder)
entries: Creatures who fail the saving throw are pushed 15 feet away from the centre of the cube and fall {@condition Prone}.

entries.name: Caustic Vent (Acid)
entries: Creatures who move through the area take {@damage 1d8} acid damage for each 5 feet moved. This effect disappears at the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At higher levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@damage 1d8} for each slot level above 2.

spell.name: Primordial Breath

m.text: A mint plant in a pot worth at least 100gp

entries: You unleash a flash of raw elemental force. Choose one effect from the options below. Creatures within a 30-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 7d6} damage of the chosen type and suffer the additional effect specified below. On a successful save, targets take half as much damage.

entries.name: Pyroclastic Smoke (Fire)
entries: Creatures who fail the saving throw become {@condition Blinded} until they or an adjacent ally clears the condition with a {@variantrule Bonus Action}.

entries.name: Flash Freeze (Cold)
entries: Creatures who fail the saving throw are {@condition Halted} until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Ionising Breath (Lightning)
entries: Creatures who fail the saving throw cannot take a {@variantrule Bonus Action} on their next turn.

entries.name: Pressure Wave (Thunder)
entries: All creatures in the area are pushed 10 feet away from you.

entries.name: Acidic Deluge (Acid)
entries: Creatures in the area take an additional 3d6 acid damage at the end of their next turn unless they use an {@variantrule Action} to wipe the acid from themselves.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At higher levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@damage 1d6} for each slot level above 3.

spell.name: Primordial Cloudburst

m.text: A lapis stone worth at least 150gp

entries: You call forth a cloud of energy that fills the area beneath it with an elemental effect. Choose one effect from the options below. Creatures within a 30-foot radius, 40-foot tall {@variantrule Cylinder [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cylinder} centered on a point within range must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 8d6} damage of the chosen type. On a success, they take half the damage only. The area is then filled with the chosen effect until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Scalding Water (Fire)
entries: Creatures ending their turn within the area become {@condition Burning|Starlight}.

entries.name: Sleet Rain (Cold)
entries: The area is filled with a thick mist and is {@variantrule Heavily Obscured|XPHB}.

entries.name: Stormclouds (Lightning)
entries: The air is filled with static electricity; creatures cannot take {@variantrule Reaction|Reactions} within the area.

entries.name: Thunderclouds (Thunder)
entries: Creatures are {@condition Silenced|Starlight} while in the area.

entries.name: Acid Rain (Acid)
entries: Creatures attacking from within the area take {@damage 1d6} damage whenever they attack.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At higher levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4.

spell.name: Primordial Spire

m.text: A stone model of a tower worth at least 200gp

entries: You summon an ancient monolith imbued with an elemental power chosen from the options below. The monolith has a radius of 20 feet and a height of up to 60 feet, filling any height lower than that. Creatures in the way of the monolith can choose to make a Dexterity saving throw to be placed at the edge of the area, otherwise they remain on top. If there is not space on top for the creature, they are crushed for {@damage 4d10} bludgeoning damage and then dropped outside of the area

entries.name: Pillar of Flame (Fire)
entries: Creatures who end their turn within 10 feet of the monolith take {@damage 6d8} fire damage, objects not being worn or carried ignite. This monolith can be travelled through; it provides 3/4 cover to creatures in or on the other side of it and is {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}.

entries.name: Fang of Ice (Cold)
entries: Creatures who end their turn within 10 feet of this solid monolith take {@damage 5d8} cold damage and are {@condition Hampered|Starlight} until the end of their next turn.

entries.name: Obelisk of Storms (Lightning)
entries: Lightning is drawn towards this solid mineral spire. Creatures who start their turn within 10 feet of the spire can take an {@variantrule Action} or {@variantrule Bonus Action} on their turn, not both. Additionally, when a creature takes lightning damage while near the spire, it is increased by {@damage 2d8}.

entries.name: Spire of Echoes (Thunder)
entries: Resonations from this stone spire amplify sound. Creatures of your choice within 20 feet of the spire are vulnerable to Thunder damage. Creatures casting spells while within 20 feet of the spire have advantage on any attack rolls made as part of that spell.

entries.name: Thorn of Nox (Acid)
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 10 feet of the spire, it is {@condition Hampered|Starlight} and attack and damage rolls are reduced by {@dice 1d6} until the start of its next turn, and attack and damage rolls made against it are increased by {@dice 1d6} for the same duration.

spell.name: Primordial Tempest
entries: You conjure an ancient storm in the form of a 30-foot radius, 60-foot-tall {@variantrule Cylinder [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cylinder}, centred on a point within range, which moves 20 feet in a direction of your choice at the start of each of your turns. Choose one effect from the options below. Creatures who enter the tempest or start their turn in it must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 6d10} damage of the chosen type, taking half as much on a success. The tempest also applies the chosen affect within its area for the duration.

entries.name: Superheated Winds (Fire)
entries: Objects that are not worn or carried ignite. Creatures within the area have disadvantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain {@status Concentration}.

entries.name: White Gale (Cold)
entries: Dense snow makes the area {@variantrule Heavily Obscured|XPHB} and {@condition Hampered|Starlight|Hampers} creatures who start their turn in it until the end of their turn.

entries.name: Static Storm (Lightning)
entries: At the start of each of your turns, choose a creature within the storm to be struck by lightning. It must succeed an additional Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d10} lightning damage

entries.name: Howling Squall (Thunder)
entries: Creatures within are {@condition Deafened} and {@condition Silenced|Starlight}.

entries.name: Toxic Fumes (Acid)
entries: Creatures within the tempest cannot benefit from any damage resistances, and their immunities are treated as resistances.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At higher levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 4.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the treant is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the treant move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check to discern that the treant is animate.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Taunting Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.
Hostile creatures within this totem's area have disadvantage on any attack that doesn't target the totem.

trait.name: Totemic Might
entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|Starlight} Primordial Rune.}

bonus.name: Totemic Blast (Requires Totemic Blast Primordial Rune)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8+PB} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Blast|Starlight} Primordial Rune to use.

reaction.name: Totem Commander
entries: The totem takes the damage of an attack that would hit a creature it is attached to.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totem Commander|Starlight} Primordial Rune to use.

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Warning Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.
Once per round, creatures within the area can gain a bonus to one saving throw they make. The bonus is equal to half your spellcasting ability modifier (rounded up).

trait.name: Totemic Might
entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|Starlight} Primordial Rune.}

bonus.name: Totemic Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8+PB} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Blast|Starlight} Primordial Rune to use.

reaction.name: Totem Commander
entries: The totem takes the damage of an attack that would hit a creature it is attached to.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totem Commander|Starlight} Primordial Rune to use.

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Warding Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.
When a creature hostile to you attempts to enter the totem's area, it must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or become {@condition Halted|Starlight} until the end of its turn.

trait.name: Totemic Might
entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|Starlight} Primordial Rune.}

bonus.name: Totemic Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8+PB} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Blast|Starlight} Primordial Rune to use.

reaction.name: Totem Commander
entries: The totem takes the damage of an attack that would hit a creature it is attached to.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totem Commander|Starlight} Primordial Rune to use.

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Lifting Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.

When a friendly creature would enter this totem's area, it can spend an additional 5 feet of movement to be lifted by elemental winds and carried to the opposite side of the area. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.
A friendly creature that starts its turn within the area gains 10 feet of movement speed for that turn.

trait.name: Totemic Might
entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|Starlight} Primordial Rune.}

bonus.name: Totemic Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8+PB} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Blast|Starlight} Primordial Rune to use.

reaction.name: Totem Commander
entries: The totem takes the damage of an attack that would hit a creature it is attached to.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totem Commander|Starlight} Primordial Rune to use.

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Blessing Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.
Once per round, creatures within the area can gain a bonus to one attack roll or ability check they make. The bonus is equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

trait.name: Totemic Might
entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|Starlight} Primordial Rune.}

bonus.name: Totemic Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8+PB} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Blast|Starlight} Primordial Rune to use.

reaction.name: Totem Commander
entries: The totem takes the damage of an attack that would hit a creature it is attached to.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totem Commander|Starlight} Primordial Rune to use.

monster.name: Wrath of Air Nature Spirit Totem

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Wrath of Air Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.

Once per round, any creature within the totem's area may add their spellcasting ability modifier to one damage roll from an attack or spell. If they do not have a spellcasting ability modifier, they use their Wisdom ability modifier.

trait.name: Totemic Might
entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|Starlight} Primordial Rune.}

bonus.name: Totemic Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8+PB} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Blast|Starlight} Primordial Rune to use.

reaction.name: Totem Commander
entries: The totem takes the damage of an attack that would hit a creature it is attached to.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totem Commander|Starlight} Primordial Rune to use.

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Manarage Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.

Creatures within this area may cast one first-level spell without expending a spell slot, or use any feature which can be used more than once per {@variantrule Short Rest}, without expending a use of that feature.

trait.name: Totemic Might
entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|Starlight} Primordial Rune.}

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Enforcement Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.
Creatures in the area that you choose gain temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier at the start of each of your turns. They cannot be moved against their will.

trait.name: Totemic Might
entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|Starlight} Primordial Rune.}

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Searing Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.

Any creature which enters the area for the first time on a turn, or starts its turn there, becomes {@condition burning|Starlight}. If a creature is already {@condition burning|Starlight}, it takes {@dice 1d4} fire damage instead.

trait.name: Glacial Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.
The area is difficult terrain for creatures of your choice. Additionally, those creatures cannot regain hit points while in the area.

trait.name: Voltaic Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.
Creatures of your choice within the area are unable to take {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB|Reactions}.

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Booming Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.

At the start of your turns, the totem emits a shockwave. Each creature of your choice within the totem's area must make a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet directly away from the totem.
